001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.max;
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.min;
005
006import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
007
008
009/**
010 * <p>
011 * Implementation of HSV (hue/saturation/value) color space.
012 * See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for additional details.
013 * All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
014 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
015 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/09/04
023 */
024@SuppressWarnings("serial")
025public class HsvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
026        
027        private static final HsvColorSpace instance = new HsvColorSpace();
028        
029        public static HsvColorSpace getInstance() {
030                return instance;
031        }
032        
033        private HsvColorSpace() {
034                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_HSV, 3);
035        }
036
037        @Override
038        public float[] fromRGB(float[] rgb) {
039                final float R = rgb[0], G = rgb[1], B = rgb[2]; // R,G,B in [0,1]               
040                final float cHi = max(R, G, B);                                 // max. component value
041                final float cLo = min(R, G, B);                                 // min. component value
042                final float cRng = cHi - cLo;                               // component range
043                
044                // compute value V
045                float V = cHi;
046                float H = 0;
047                float S = 0;
048                
049                // compute saturation S
050                if (cHi > 0)
051                        S = (float) cRng / cHi;
052
053                // compute hue H
054                if (cRng > 0) { // hue is defined only for color pixels
055                        float rr = (float)(cHi - R) / cRng;
056                        float gg = (float)(cHi - G) / cRng;
057                        float bb = (float)(cHi - B) / cRng;
058                        float hh;
059                        if (R == cHi)                   // R is largest component value
060                                hh = bb - gg;
061                        else if (G == cHi)              // G is largest component value
062                                hh = rr - bb + 2;
063                        else                            // B is largest component value
064                                hh = gg - rr + 4;
065                        if (hh < 0)
066                                hh = hh + 6;
067                        H = hh / 6;
068                }
069                return new float[] {H, S, V};
070        }
071        
072        @Override
073        public float[] toRGB(float[] hsv) {
074                final float H = hsv[0], S = hsv[1], V = hsv[2];  // H,S,V in [0,1]
075                final float hh = (6 * H) % 6;                 
076                final int   c1 = (int) hh;                     
077                final float c2 = hh - c1;
078                final float x = (1 - S) * V;
079                final float y = (1 - (S * c2)) * V;
080                final float z = (1 - (S * (1 - c2))) * V;
081                float r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
082                switch (c1) {
083                        case 0: r = V; g = z; b = x; break;
084                        case 1: r = y; g = V; b = x; break;
085                        case 2: r = x; g = V; b = z; break;
086                        case 3: r = x; g = y; b = V; break;
087                        case 4: r = z; g = x; b = V; break;
088                        case 5: r = V; g = x; b = y; break;
089                        default: // this should not happen
090                }
091                return new float[] {r, g, b};
092        }
093
094        @Override
095        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
096                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
101                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
102        }
103
104}
